content.raw:
Thank you very much for your drawings, they cleared things up. The implementation corresponds to figure `B`. My guess is that it should generally be more straightforward for the user to express the position of the camera in world frame rather than in model frame, and then set `inherit_yaw` to `true` whenever desired.

To get the behaviour of figure `B`, we could replace `inherit_yaw` by a more generic `inherit_rot` vector3. In that case, the behaviour of figure `A` could be obtained by setting `<inherit_rot>` to `true true true`.
